#↩

Notes

笔记

Chapter 1: Embracing Chaos

第一章：拥抱混乱

As manager of a private investment firm : Jay Sheldon is a former colleague of mine. He has asked me to use a pseudonym. That will be my practice throughout this book. I’ll provide sources for examples that have been written about elsewhere.

作为一家私人投资公司的经理，杰伊·谢尔顿是我的前同事。他要求我使用化名。本书通篇我都会使用化名。对于其他地方已有的例子，我会提供出处。

colleagues at the Program on Negotiation : The program was founded in 1983 and is based at the Harvard Law School. PON hosts academic conferences, offers executive training programs, and publishes the Negotiation Journal . Its website is www.pon.harvard.edu .

谈判项目（Program on Negotiation，简称PON）的同事们：该项目成立于1983年，隶属于哈佛法学院。PON举办学术会议，提供高管培训项目，并出版《谈判期刊》（Negotiation Journal）。其网站为www.pon.harvard.edu。

The late ambassador Richard Holbrooke : PON awarded Ambassador Holbrooke its Great Negotiator Award in 2004. In his acceptance remarks, he said, “This award honors the art of negotiation. I say ‘art’ intentionally because it is not a science and never will be.” For a summary of his comments, see www.pon.harvard.edu/events/richard-holbrooke-receives-the-2004-great-negotiator-award .

已故的理查德·霍尔布鲁克大使：2004年，PON授予霍尔布鲁克大使“杰出谈判家奖”。他在获奖感言中说道：“这个奖项旨在表彰谈判的艺术。我特意用‘艺术’这个词，因为它不是科学，也永远不会是科学。” 如需了解他的获奖感言摘要，请访问 www.pon.harvard.edu/events/richard-holbrooke-receives-the-2004-great-negotiator-award。

UN special envoy Lakhdar Brahimi : His comment was made during a seminar that was held when he received PON’s Great Negotiator Award in 2002. Video of the event is available from the program’s clearinghouse: www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2 .

联合国特使拉赫达尔·卜拉希米：他的这番话是在2002年他获得PON“伟大谈判者奖”时举办的一次研讨会上说的。该活动的视频可从该项目的资料库获取：www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2。

Dell has also done very well : See Donald Dell, Never Make the First Offer (Except When You Should): Wisdom from a Master Dealmaker (Portfolio, 2009), p. 27. His advice about assuming there is something that you don’t know appears on page 59 . (Emphasis added.)

戴尔在这方面也做得非常出色：参见唐纳德·戴尔的《永远不要先出价（除非你应该）：一位交易大师的智慧》（Portfolio出版社，2009年），第27页。他关于假设存在你不知道的事情的建议出现在第59页。（重点为笔者所加。）

Tom Green is a remarkable negotiator : Tom joined the Massachusetts Attorney General’s Office after seven years on Wall Street. His knowledge of law and finance made him an important member of the team that coordinated the multistate settlement with the major tobacco companies. See Tobacco Negotiations , a case study by Michael Wheeler and Georgia Levenson (product number 899049), July 30, 1998, Harvard Business Publishing.

汤姆·格林是一位杰出的谈判专家：在华尔街工作七年后，他加入了马萨诸塞州总检察长办公室。他对法律和金融的精通使他成为协调多州与大型烟草公司达成和解协议团队的重要成员。参见迈克尔·惠勒和乔治亚·莱文森合著的案例研究《烟草谈判》（产品编号899049），1998年7月30日由哈佛商业出版社出版。

The story of how : The Citibank land assembly negotiations are described in greater detail in chapter 4, “Plan B.” See also Peter Hellman’s article “How They Assembled the Most Expensive Block in New York’s History,” New York , February 25, 1974, pp. 30–37.

事情经过是怎样的：花旗银行土地收购谈判在第 4 章“B 计划”中有更详细的描述。另请参阅 Peter Hellman 的文章“他们是如何收购纽约历史上最昂贵的街区的”，纽约，1974 年 2 月 25 日，第 30-37 页。

The board of a co-op : See Wade Lambert, “Ever Hear the One About the Lawyers and the Window Bars,” Wall Street Journal , March 23, 1994, p. 1.

合作公寓的董事会：参见 Wade Lambert，“你听说过关于律师和窗户栏杆的故事吗？”，《华尔街日报》，1994 年 3 月 23 日，第 1 页。

The groundbreaking negotiating text : Bruce Patton joined Roger Fisher and William Ury for the second—as well as subsequent—editions of Getting to Yes (Penguin Books, 1991).

开创性的谈判著作：布鲁斯·帕顿与罗杰·费舍尔和威廉·尤里共同撰写了《谈判力》（Getting to Yes）的第二版以及后续版本（企鹅出版社，1991 年）。

Books such as Jim Camp’s : See Jim Camp, Start with No: America’s Number One Negotiating Coach Explains Why Win-Win Is a Disastrous Strategy, and How You Can Beat It (Crown Business, 2002).

例如吉姆·坎普的著作：《吉姆·坎普，从“不”开始：美国排名第一的谈判教练解释了为什么双赢是一种灾难性的策略，以及如何战胜它》（皇冠商业出版社，2002 年）。

A lot of good work : These books include Beyond Reason: Using Emotions as You Negotiate by Roger Fisher and Daniel Shapiro (Penguin Books, 2006); Getting Past No: Negotiating in Difficult Situations by William Ury (Bantam Books, 1993); and Difficult Conversations: How to Discuss What Matters Most by Douglas Stone, Bruce Patton, and Sheila Heen (Penguin Books, 2010). Other contributions to negotiation literature have been made by David Lax and James Sebenius, most recently in 3-D Negotiation: Powerful Tools to Change the Game in Your Most Important Deals (Harvard Business School Press, 2006); Robert Mnookin, Scott Peppett, and Andrew Tulumello, Beyond Winning: Negotiating to Create Value in Deals and Disputes (Harvard University Press, 2004); Lawrence Susskind and Patrick Field, Dealing with an Angry Public: The Mutual Gains Approach to Resolving Disputes (Free Press, 2010); and Deborah Kolb, Judith Williams, and Carol Frohlinger, Her Place at the Table: A Woman’s Guide to Negotiating Five Key Challenges to Leadership Success (Jossey-Bass, 2010).

许多优秀著作包括：罗杰·费舍尔和丹尼尔·夏皮罗合著的《超越理性：在谈判中运用情绪》（企鹅出版社，2006年）；威廉·尤里著的《超越拒绝：在困境中谈判》（班塔姆出版社，1993年）；以及道格拉斯·斯通、布鲁斯·帕顿和希拉·希恩合著的《艰难对话：如何讨论最重要的事》（企鹅出版社，2010年）。其他对谈判文献做出贡献的还有大卫·拉克和詹姆斯·塞贝纽斯，他们最近的著作是《三维谈判：改变你最重要的交易格局的强大工具》（哈佛商学院出版社，2006年）；罗伯特·姆努金、斯科特·佩佩特和安德鲁·图卢梅洛合著的《超越胜利：在交易和纠纷中通过谈判创造价值》（哈佛大学出版社，2004年）。 Lawrence Susskind 和 Patrick Field，《应对愤怒的公众：解决争端的互利共赢方法》（自由出版社，2010 年）；以及 Deborah Kolb、Judith Williams 和 Carol Frohlinger，《她在谈判桌上的位置：女性应对领导力成功的五大关键挑战的指南》（Jossey-Bass 出版社，2010 年）。

The standard model doesn’t capture : None of my colleagues denies the dynamic nature of negotiation. See, for example, Lax and Sebenius, 3-D Negotiation , p. 253, who state that “negotiating effectively isn’t like following a recipe that is written out before you start.” They note that key factors “tend to stay in play and to evolve, often dramatically,” hence you must “continually update and adjust your approach.”

标准模型无法捕捉到以下特点：我的同事们都认同谈判的动态性。例如，参见 Lax 和 Sebenius 合著的《三维谈判》（3-D Negotiation）第 253 页，他们指出“有效谈判并非像事先写好的菜谱那样按部就班”。他们强调，关键因素“往往会持续发挥作用并不断演变，而且变化往往非常剧烈”，因此你必须“不断更新和调整你的谈判策略”。

Savvy real estate brokers : See Timothy Wilson, Strangers to Ourselves: Discovering the Adaptive Unconscious (Cambridge, Mass: Harvard University Press, 2002), pp. 164–65.

精明的房地产经纪人：请参阅 Timothy Wilson 的《我们自身的陌生人：发现适应性无意识》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，2002 年），第 164-165 页。

Part 1: A Sense of Direction

第一部分：方向感

You’d be surprised : Charlene Barshefsky served as US trade representative, the country’s top trade negotiator, from 1997 to 2001. In 2004 she received the Great Negotiator Award from the Program on Negotiation. For the quotation, see Charlene Barshefsky (B) , a case study by James Sebenius and Rebecca Hulse (product number 801422), March 29, 2001, Harvard Business Publishing.

你可能会感到惊讶：查琳·巴尔谢夫斯基曾于1997年至2001年担任美国贸易代表，是美国首席贸易谈判代表。2004年，她荣获谈判项目颁发的“杰出谈判家奖”。引文出自詹姆斯·塞贝纽斯和丽贝卡·赫尔斯撰写的案例研究《查琳·巴尔谢夫斯基（B）》（产品编号801422），2001年3月29日由哈佛商业出版社出版。

Chapter 2: A Map of the Pyrenees

第二章：比利牛斯山脉地图

Many years ago : Well-known organizational theorist Karl Weick recounted this story in an interview by Diana Coutu, “Sense and Reliability: A Conversation with Celebrated Psychologist Karl E. Weick,” Harvard Business Review , April 2003, p. 86. Weick commented, “In crises especially, leaders have to act in order to think, not the other way around.”

多年前：著名组织理论家卡尔·韦克在戴安娜·库图的采访中讲述了这个故事，该采访发表于《哈佛商业评论》2003 年 4 月刊第 86 页，题为“感知与可靠性：与著名心理学家卡尔·E·韦克的对话”。韦克评论道：“尤其是在危机中，领导者必须先行动才能思考，而不是反过来。”

Herb Cohen recounts stories : His story about buying a $489.50 refrigerator for $450 can be found in the paperback edition of You Can Negotiate Anything (Bantam Books, 1982), pp. 31–37.

赫伯·科恩讲述了他的故事：他以 450 美元的价格买到了一台价值 489.50 美元的冰箱，这个故事可以在《你可以谈判任何事情》（Bantam Books，1982 年）的平装版中找到，第 31-37 页。

But asking can be risky : Arvind Gupta is a pseudonym of a justifiably well-regarded negotiation teacher.

但询问此事可能存在风险：Arvind Gupta 是一位备受推崇的谈判教师的笔名。

Compare Arvind’s blunder : Liz and Tony Weiler are pseudonyms of old friends of mine who told me this story as it was unfolding.

对比一下 Arvind 的错误：Liz 和 Tony Weiler 是我的老朋友的化名，他们在事情发生时告诉我这个故事。

it’s a matter of comparing two paths : The best, most practical introduction to decision analysis is Smart Choices: A Practical Guide to Making Better Decisions by John Hammond, Ralph Keeney, and Howard Raiffa (Harvard Business, 1999).

这其实是比较两条路径的问题：对决策分析来说，最好、最实用的入门读物是约翰·哈蒙德、拉尔夫·基尼和霍华德·雷法合著的《明智的选择：做出更好决策的实用指南》（哈佛商学院，1999 年）。

When Harvard economist Richard Zeckhauser : The experiment is described in Howard Raiffa, The Art and Science of Negotiation: How to Resolve Conflicts and Get the Best out of Bargaining (Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press, 1982), p. 52.

哈佛经济学家理查德·泽克豪瑟：该实验在霍华德·雷法的《谈判的艺术与科学：如何解决冲突并从谈判中获得最大利益》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，1982 年）第 52 页中有所描述。

this was a lose-lose negotiation : Stubbornness may have been part of the reason for the 2012–13 stalemate. Each side may have been convinced that the other would blink in the face of mounting losses. But there’s another explanation, as well: internal dynamics. Tough bargaining took place inside each group. Every NHL team wanted to cap its payroll expenses, but teams turning a profit had different incentives than those running losses. (It’s rumored that some of the latter were actually losing less money by being shut down.) Likewise, some members of the players’ union had been earning thirty times as much as their less talented teammates. Those stars had more at stake, but most also had the resources to ride out the impasse. Marginal players had less to fall back upon. It likely was hard for each side to build internal consensus over what would ultimately be acceptable. The story of the 2004–05 lockout is told in a case study by my colleague Deepak Malhotra and his research associate Maly Hout, Negotiating on Thin Ice: The 2004–2005 NHL Dispute (A/B) (product numbers 906038/906039), February 14, 2006 (Harvard Business Publishing).

这是一场双输的谈判：双方的固执可能是导致2012-13赛季僵局的部分原因。双方可能都认为，面对不断增加的损失，对方最终会妥协。但还有另一种解释：内部因素。双方内部都进行了艰难的谈判。每支NHL球队都想限制工资支出，但盈利球队和亏损球队的动机截然不同。（有传言称，一些亏损球队停赛实际上损失更少。）同样，一些球员协会成员的收入是其他球员的三十倍。这些明星球员的利益攸关更大，但他们中的大多数人也有足够的资源来度过僵局。而边缘球员则缺乏保障。双方可能都很难就最终可以接受的方案达成内部共识。我的同事 Deepak Malhotra 和他的研究助理 Maly Hout 在一篇案例研究中讲述了 2004-05 年停摆的故事，该案例研究名为《如履薄冰的谈判：2004-2005 年 NHL 纠纷（A/B）》（产品编号 906038/906039），于 2006 年 2 月 14 日由哈佛商业出版社出版。

A few years ago : The following story was told in detail by Wall Street Journal reporter Daniel Michaels, who had confidential access to all the parties as the negotiation progressed. “Airbus and Boeing Duke It Out to Win Lucrative Iberia Deal,” Wall Street Journal , March 10, 2003, p. 1., http://faculty.washington.edu/sundar/MM-BBUS320/Fun-READINGS/Airbus-Boeing%20for%20Iberia%20Deal.pdf .

几年前：以下故事由《华尔街日报》记者丹尼尔·迈克尔斯详细报道，他获得了与谈判各方进行秘密接触的机会。“空客和波音为赢得利润丰厚的伊比利亚航空合同而展开激烈角逐”，《华尔街日报》，2003年3月10日，第1页，http://faculty.washington.edu/sundar/MM-BBUS320/Fun-READINGS/Airbus-Boeing%20for%20Iberia%20Deal.pdf。

Nobel laureate Tom Schelling : The capacity to commit oneself, Schelling explains in his “Essay on Bargaining,” even if it is to a dangerous course of action, is a form of bargaining power. The essay is the second chapter in his The Strategy of Conflict (Harvard University Press, 1981).

诺贝尔经济学奖得主汤姆·谢林在其著作《论谈判》中解释道，即使采取危险的行动，也要勇于承担责任，这本身就是一种谈判能力。该文是其著作《冲突的战略》（哈佛大学出版社，1981年）的第二章。

Fox Television’s prominence : See Richard Sandomir, “Fox Network Outbids CBS for Rights to Pro Football,” New York Times , December 18, 1993, p. 1.

福克斯电视台的显赫地位：参见理查德·桑多米尔，《福克斯电视网击败哥伦比亚广播公司赢得职业橄榄球转播权》，《纽约时报》，1993 年 12 月 18 日，第 1 页。

Putting a toe in the water : I’m grateful to Sandy for letting me tell this story.

试水：我很感谢桑迪让我讲述这个故事。

It’s a strategic planning technique : For a fuller description of this technique, see Gary Klein, Intuition at Work: Why Developing Your Gut Instincts Will Make You Better at What You Do (Doubleday-Currency, 2003).

这是一种战略规划技巧：有关此技巧的更完整描述，请参阅 Gary Klein 的《工作中的直觉：为什么培养你的直觉会让你在工作中表现得更好》（Doubleday-Currency，2003 年）。

Studies show that negotiators : Deborah Zetik and Alice Stulmacher, “Goal Setting and Negotiation Performance: A Meta-Analysis,” Group Processes & Intergroup Relations 5, no. 1 (January 2002): pp. 35–52. This meta-analysis of almost two dozen studies showed that negotiators who held specific and challenging goals outperformed others whose aims were lower.

研究表明，谈判者：Deborah Zetik 和 Alice Stulmacher，“目标设定与谈判绩效：一项元分析”，《群体过程与群体间关系》5，第 1 期（2002 年 1 月）：第 35-52 页。这项对近二十项研究的元分析表明，设定具体且具有挑战性目标的谈判者比目标较低的谈判者表现更佳。

In a recent experiment : See Adam Galinsky, Geoffrey Leonardelli, Gerardo Okhuysen, and Thomas Mussweiler, “Regulatory Focus at the Bargaining Table: Promoting Distributive and Integrative Success,” Personality and Social Psychology Bulletin 31, no. 8 (August 2005): pp. 1087–98.

在最近的一项实验中：参见 Adam Galinsky、Geoffrey Leonardelli、Gerardo Okhuysen 和 Thomas Mussweiler，“谈判桌上的调节焦点：促进分配和整合的成功”，《人格与社会心理学公报》31，第 8 期（2005 年 8 月）：第 1087-98 页。

Fortunately, they didn’t fall : Hikers use the phrase “bending the map” to describe how people convince themselves that they aren’t really lost. (For example, “The map says that there’s supposed to be a lake here, but it must have dried up.”)

幸好他们没有摔倒：徒步旅行者用“扭曲地图”来形容人们如何说服自己并没有迷路。（例如，“地图上说这里应该有个湖，但它肯定干涸了。”）

Chapter 3: Prospecting

第三章：勘探

To illustrate the importance of preparation : The results of this exercise are described and analyzed in “First Let’s Kill All the Agents,” a chapter I wrote in a collection edited by Robert Mnookin and Lawrence Susskind, Negotiating on Behalf of Others: Advice to Lawyers, Business Executives, Sports Agents, Diplomats, Politicians, and Everybody Else (Sage Publications, 1999), pp. 235–62.

为了说明准备的重要性：我在罗伯特·姆努金和劳伦斯·萨斯金德编辑的文集《代表他人谈判：给律师、企业高管、体育经纪人、外交官、政治家和所有人的建议》（Sage Publications，1999 年）第 235-262 页中撰写的章节“首先让我们干掉所有代理人”中描述和分析了这项练习的结果。

Because it considers only price : See Max Bazerman, “Negotiator Judgment: A Critical Look at the Rationality Assumption,” American Behavioral Scientist 27, no. 2 (November 1983): pp. 211–28, at 215–18.

因为它只考虑价格：参见 Max Bazerman，“谈判者的判断：对理性假设的批判性审视”，《美国行为科学家》27，第 2 期（1983 年 11 月）：第 211-228 页，第 215-218 页。

We’ll start with the deal triangle : At first glance, the triangle here may look the same as those depicting Pareto superior deals, but this is constructed differently. In this construction, your baseline is an indifference curve located by different outcomes that you value the same . In the Pareto diagram, the horizontal and vertical axes are scales on which ascending value of different deals is measured.

我们先来看交易三角：乍一看，这个三角可能与帕累托最优交易的三角相似，但它们的构成方式不同。在这个构成中，你的基准线是一条无差异曲线，它由你认为价值相同的不同结果确定。而在帕累托图中，横轴和纵轴是衡量不同交易价值递增的标尺。

Research suggests : See Arvind Rangaswamy and G. Richard Shell, “Using Computers to Realize Joint Gains in Negotiations,” Management Science 43, no. 8 (August 1997): pp. 1147–63. This study suggests that preparing for negotiation by thinking more rigorously about one’s own trade-offs stimulates negotiators to find more value creating solutions.

研究表明：参见 Arvind Rangaswamy 和 G. Richard Shell 的文章“利用计算机在谈判中实现共同收益”，载于《管理科学》第 43 卷第 8 期（1997 年 8 月），第 1147-1163 页。该研究表明，谈判者通过更严谨地思考自身的权衡取舍来准备谈判，可以激励他们找到更多创造价值的解决方案。

Jack Binion, a celebrated Las Vegas casino operator : See symposium transcript, “How to Play Your Hand: Lessons for Negotiators from Poker,” UNLV Gaming Law Journal 2, no. 2 (December 2011): 231–53, http://scholars.law.unlv.edu/glj/vol2/iss2/5 .

拉斯维加斯著名赌场运营商杰克·比尼恩：参见研讨会记录，“如何打好你的牌：扑克牌给谈判者的启示”，UNLV 博彩法杂志 2，第 2 期（2011 年 12 月）：231-53，http://scholars.law.unlv.edu/glj/vol2/iss2/5。

Swarthmore College psychologist Barry Schwartz : See Barry Schwartz, The Paradox of Choice: Why More Is Less (Harper Perennial, 2005). For the research on happiness, see Sheena Iyengar, Rachael Wells, and Barry Schwartz, “Doing Better but Feeling Worse: Looking for the ‘Best’ Job Undermines Satisfaction,” Psychological Science 17, no. 2 (2006): pp. 143–50.

斯沃斯莫尔学院心理学家巴里·施瓦茨：参见巴里·施瓦茨，《选择的悖论：为什么越多越少》（哈珀·柯林斯出版社，2005年）。关于幸福的研究，参见希娜·艾扬格、瑞秋·威尔斯和巴里·施瓦茨合著的《做得更好但感觉更糟：寻找“最好”的工作会降低满意度》，载于《心理科学》第17卷第2期（2006年），第143-150页。

Consider Hollywood producer : See Jerry Weintraub, When I Stop Talking, You’ll Know I’m Dead: Useful Stories from a Persuasive Man (Twelve, 2010), pp. 199–201 (the John Denver story) and 268–69 ( Ocean’s Eleven , Twelve , and Thirteen ).

以好莱坞制片人为例：参见 Jerry Weintraub 的《当我停止说话时，你就知道我死了：一个有说服力的人的有用故事》（Twelve，2010 年），第 199-201 页（约翰·丹佛的故事）和第 268-269 页（《十一罗汉》、《十二罗汉》和《十三罗汉》）。

Chapter 4: Plan B

第四章：备选方案

The Citibank Center : The Citibank land assembly negotiations mentioned briefly in the first chapter are described in Peter Hellman’s article “How They Assembled the Most Expensive Block in New York’s History,” New York , February 25, 1974, pp. 30–37. Holdouts! by Andrew Alpern and Seymour Durst (McGraw-Hill, 1984) describes this case and other contentious real estate negotiations.

花旗银行中心：第一章简要提及的花旗银行土地整合谈判在彼得·赫尔曼的文章《他们如何整合纽约历史上最昂贵的街区》（纽约，1974 年 2 月 25 日，第 30-37 页）中有详细描述。安德鲁·阿尔珀恩和西摩·杜斯特合著的《坚守者！》（麦格劳-希尔出版社，1984 年）描述了此案和其他有争议的房地产谈判。

Just as that new tower : See Calvin Trillin, “U.S. Journal: Atlantic City, N.J.— Land Assemblage,” New Yorker , January 8, 1979, p. 44.

就像那座新塔一样：参见 Calvin Trillin，“美国杂志：新泽西州大西洋城——土地集合”，《纽约客》，1979 年 1 月 8 日，第 44 页。

The Walt Disney Company should have : For a fuller description of this case, see Michael Wheeler and Georgia Levenson, Disney: The Third Battle of Bull Run (product number 909030), December 9, 2008, Harvard Business Publishing; and Marcia Synnott, “Disney’s America: Whose Patrimony, Whose Profits, Whose Past?,” Public Historian 17, no. 4 (Fall 1995): pp. 43–59.

华特迪士尼公司本应：有关此案的更完整描述，请参阅 Michael Wheeler 和 Georgia Levenson 合著的《迪士尼：第三次布尔河战役》（产品编号 909030），2008 年 12 月 9 日，哈佛商业出版社；以及 Marcia Synnott 的文章《迪士尼的美国：谁的遗产，谁的利润，谁的过去？》，载于《公共历史学家》第 17 卷第 4 期（1995 年秋季），第 43-59 页。

Part 2: Improvising

第二部分：即兴发挥

Some situations are like : Ambassador Richard Holbrooke, who mediated the Dayton Accords ending the bloodshed in the former Yugoslavia, received the Program on Negotiation’s Great Negotiator Award on November 12, 2004.

有些情况就像：2004 年 11 月 12 日，促成结束前南斯拉夫流血冲突的代顿协议的理查德·霍尔布鲁克大使获得了谈判计划颁发的“伟大谈判者奖”。

Chapter 5: Presence of Mind

第五章：临场应变

First, there’s Donald Dell : See Dell, Never Make the First Offer, pp. 1–5.

首先是唐纳德·戴尔：参见戴尔，《永远不要先出价》，第 1-5 页。

Then there’s Chris Robbins : I’m grateful to my colleague Kim Leary for telling me about Chris Robbins. (The latter name is a pseudonym.)

还有克里斯·罗宾斯：我很感谢我的同事金·利里向我介绍了克里斯·罗宾斯这个人。（克里斯·罗宾斯是化名。）

Tom Wolfe’s novel : See Tom Wolfe, A Man in Full (Dial Press Trade Paperback, 2001), pp. 31–53.

汤姆·沃尔夫的小说：参见汤姆·沃尔夫，《一个完整的人》（Dial Press Trade Paperback，2001 年），第 31-53 页。

The classic Getting to Yes: See Fisher, Ury, and Patton, Getting to Yes , 2nd ed. (Penguin Books, 1991), pp. 17–39.

经典著作《谈判力》：参见 Fisher、Ury 和 Patton 合著的《谈判力》，第 2 版（企鹅出版社，1991 年），第 17-39 页。

Later in his career : See Fisher and Shapiro, Beyond Reason .

他的职业生涯后期：参见 Fisher 和 Shapiro 合著的《超越理性》。

Averell Harriman, a diplomat : See obituary by Steve Neal, Chicago Tribune , July 27, 1986. “Mr. Harriman liked the nickname so much that he used it as his code name in confidential diplomatic cables, and he collected stuffed crocodiles and silver crocodile pins.”

外交官艾弗雷尔·哈里曼：参见史蒂夫·尼尔于 1986 年 7 月 27 日在《芝加哥论坛报》上发表的讣告。“哈里曼先生非常喜欢这个绰号，以至于他在机密外交电报中将其用作代号，他还收集鳄鱼标本和银鳄鱼胸针。”

Bruce Wasserstein, the late New York investment banker : See Laurence Grafstein, “M&A . . . and Bruce,” New Republic , October 15, 2009; www.newrepublic.com/article/economy/ma-%E2%80%A6-and-bruce .

已故纽约投资银行家布鲁斯·沃瑟斯坦：参见劳伦斯·格拉夫斯坦，《并购……与布鲁斯》，《新共和》，2009 年 10 月 15 日；www.newrepublic.com/article/economy/ma-%E2%80%A6-and-bruce。

Arnaud Karsenti, a young real estate developer : See Margie Kelley, “Arnaud Karsenti: Irrepressible Entrepreneur, Optimist, Global Dealmaker,” HBS Alumni Bulletin , June 2006, p. 23.

Arnaud Karsenti，一位年轻的房地产开发商：参见 Margie Kelley，“Arnaud Karsenti：不可抑制的企业家、乐观主义者、全球交易撮合者”，《哈佛商学院校友通报》，2006 年 6 月，第 17 页。 23.

Mihaly Csikszentmilhalyi, author : See Mihaly Csikszentmilhalyi, Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience (Harper & Row, 1990), p. 203.

米哈里·契克森米哈赖，作者：参见米哈里·契克森米哈赖，《心流：最优体验心理学》（哈珀与罗出版社，1990 年），第 203 页。

Several years ago : See Julianna Pillemer, Kimberlyn Leary, and Michael Wheeler, “Negotiating with Emotion,” Harvard Business Review , January–February 2013, pp. 96–103.

几年前：参见 Julianna Pillemer、Kimberlyn Leary 和 Michael Wheeler 的文章“用情感进行谈判”，《哈佛商业评论》，2013 年 1 月至 2 月，第 96-103 页。

To get a deeper understanding : For more information about the ZMET method, see Marketing Metaphoria: What Deep Metaphors Reveal About the Minds of Consumers by Gerald and Lindsay Zaltman (Harvard Business Press, 2008) and the Olson Zaltman Associates website, www.olsonzaltman.com .

为了更深入地了解：有关 ZMET 方法的更多信息，请参阅 Gerald 和 Lindsay Zaltman 合著的《营销隐喻：深刻的隐喻揭示了消费者的思维》（哈佛商业出版社，2008 年）以及 Olson Zaltman Associates 网站 www.olsonzaltman.com。

The subjects in our study : To see how a sample of our subjects describes its emotions about negotiation, visit the site for this project: www.people.hbs.edu/mwheeler .

我们研究的对象：要了解我们的一些研究对象如何描述他们对谈判的情感，请访问该项目的网站：www.people.hbs.edu/mwheeler。

Sports psychologists such as Robert Nideffer : See Robert Nideffer, “Getting Into the Optimal Performance State,” www.taisdata.com/articles/optimal.pdf .

运动心理学家罗伯特·尼德弗：参见罗伯特·尼德弗，《进入最佳表现状态》，www.taisdata.com/articles/optimal.pdf。

Mihaly Csikszentmilhalyi describes : See Csikszentmilhalyi, Flow , p. 4.

米哈里·契克森米哈赖描述道：参见契克森米哈赖，《心流》，第 4 页。

Studies suggest that stress : See Sian Beilock and Thomas Carr, “When High-Powered People Fail: Working Memory and ‘Choking Under Pressure’ in Math,” Psychological Science 16, no. 2 (February 2005): pp. 101–5.

研究表明压力：参见 Sian Beilock 和 Thomas Carr，“当高能力的人失败时：工作记忆和数学中的‘压力下崩溃’”，《心理科学》16，第 2 期（2005 年 2 月）：第 101-5 页。

W. Timothy Gallwey, author: See W. Timothy Gallwey, The Inner Game of Tennis: The Classic Guide to the Mental Side of Peak Performance , rev. ed. (Random House, 1997), pp. 75–78.

作者：W. Timothy Gallwey：参见 W. Timothy Gallwey，《网球的内在游戏：巅峰表现心理方面的经典指南》，修订版（兰登书屋，1997 年），第 75-78 页。

Legendary UCLA basketball coach : See Andrew Hill with John Wooden, Be Quick—But Don’t Hurry! Finding Success in the Teachings of a Lifetime ( Simon & Schuster, 2001), p. 69.

传奇的 UCLA 篮球教练：参见 Andrew Hill 与 John Wooden 合著的《快速行动——但不要着急！在人生教诲中寻找成功》（西蒙与舒斯特出版社，2001 年），第 69 页。

Champion race car driver : Stewart describes this experience in George Harrison: Living in the Material World , a Martin Scorsese documentary about George Harrison. It also can be found at http://davetrott.campaignlive.co.uk/2010/01/06/god-is-in-the-detail . Elsewhere Stewart is quoted as saying, “when I am driving really well, I always have plenty of time.” See http://jalopnik.com/5616728/what-i-learned-from-jackie-stewart-in-a-flurry-of-feathers-and-blood .

冠军赛车手斯图尔特在马丁·斯科塞斯执导的关于乔治·哈里森的纪录片《乔治·哈里森：生活在物质世界》中描述了这段经历。该片也可在以下网址找到：http://davetrott.campaignlive.co.uk/2010/01/06/god-is-in-the-detail。斯图尔特还曾说过：“当我状态极佳时，我总是有充足的时间。”参见：http://jalopnik.com/5616728/what-i-learned-from-jackie-stewart-in-a-flurry-of-feathers-and-blood。

The best negotiators are : See Ury, chap. 1, “Go to the Balcony,” in Getting Past No , pp. 31–51.

最好的谈判者是：参见 Ury，《超越拒绝》第 1 章“走到阳台上”，第 31-51 页。

The General Mills company offers : See Daniel Gelles, “The Mind Business: Yoga, Meditation, ‘Mindfulness’—Why Some of the West’s Biggest Companies Are Embracing Eastern Spirituality,” Financial Times , August 24, 2012, p. 1, for the quotations by Janice Marturano and Bill George.

通用磨坊公司提供：请参阅 Daniel Gelles 的文章“心灵事业：瑜伽、冥想、‘正念’——为什么一些西方最大的公司正在拥抱东方灵性”，《金融时报》，2012 年 8 月 24 日，第 1 页，其中引用了 Janice Marturano 和 Bill George 的话。

David Hoffman, a Boston-based mediator : See Daniel Bowling and David Hoffman, eds., Bringing Peace into the Room: How the Personal Qualities of the Mediator Impact the Process of Conflict Resolution (Jossey-Bass, 2003).

波士顿调解员大卫·霍夫曼：参见丹尼尔·鲍林和大卫·霍夫曼编著的《将和平带入房间：调解员的个人素质如何影响冲突解决过程》（Jossey-Bass出版社，2003年）。

Mindfulness has deep roots : See Shunryu Suzuki, Zen Mind, Beginner’s Mind (Shambhala Publications, 2011), p. 2.

正念有着深厚的根基：参见铃木俊隆，《禅心，初学者之心》（香巴拉出版社，2011 年），第 2 页。

Psychologist Ellen Langer : See Ellen Langer, The Power of Mindful Learning, (Boston: Addison-Wesley, 1997), p. 10.

心理学家艾伦·兰格：参见艾伦·兰格，《正念学习的力量》（波士顿：艾迪生-韦斯利出版社，1997 年），第 10 页。

As Csikszentmilhalyi says : See Csikszentmilhalyi, Flow , p. 21 (emphasis in the original).

正如 Csikszentmilhalyi 所说：参见 Csikszentmilhalyi，《心流》，第 21 页（原文强调）。

Also remember the promotion-priming : See Galinsky, Leonardelli, Okhuysen, and Mussweiler, “Regulatory Focus,” pp. 1087–98.

还要记住促进启动：参见 Galinsky、Leonardelli、Okhuysen 和 Mussweiler 的《调节焦点》，第 1087-98 页。

Chapter 6: The Swing of Things

第六章：事物的摇摆

Jazz trumpeter Wynton Marsalis says : This quotation is from the prologue to the Ken Burns Public Broadcasting Service documentary Jazz , which Marsalis hosted.

爵士小号手温顿·马萨利斯说：这句话出自肯·伯恩斯为美国公共广播服务公司制作的纪录片《爵士乐》的序言，该片由马萨利斯主持。

The late Richard Holbrooke : PON awarded Ambassador Holbrooke its Great Negotiator Award in 2004. For a summary of his comments, see www.pon.harvard.edu/events/richard-holbrooke-receives-the-2004-great-negotiator-award .

已故的理查德·霍尔布鲁克：PON 于 2004 年授予霍尔布鲁克大使“伟大谈判者奖”。有关他的发言摘要，请访问 www.pon.harvard.edu/events/richard-holbrooke-receives-the-2004-great-negotiator-award。

The Roots have remained : Tariq “Black Thought” Trotter’s remark is from an interview on National Public Radio’s Weekend Edition on December 18, 2011.

根源依然存在：塔里克·“黑思想”·特罗特 (Tariq “Black Thought” Trotter) 的这番话出自 2011 年 12 月 18 日美国国家公共广播电台周末版的一次采访。

Jazz great Herbie Hancock has described : My colleague Frank Barrett heard Hancock interviewed.

爵士乐巨匠赫比·汉考克曾这样描述过：我的同事弗兰克·巴雷特听过汉考克的采访。

As Flow author : See Csikszentmilhalyi, Flow , p. 204.

作为《心流》的作者：参见 Csikszentmilhalyi，《心流》，第 204 页。

Sigmund Freud stressed : See Jeremy Safran and Christopher Muran, Negotiating the Therapeutic Alliance: A Relational Treatment Guide (Guilford Press, 2000), p. 36.

西格蒙德·弗洛伊德强调：参见杰里米·萨弗兰和克里斯托弗·穆兰，《协商治疗联盟：关系治疗指南》（吉尔福德出版社，2000 年），第 36 页。

Trumpeter Miles Davis : The quotation can be found in Adam Shatz’s review of John Szwed’s So What: The Life of Miles Davis (Simon & Schuster, 2002). The review appeared in the Sunday Book Review of the New York Times , December 29, 2002, p. 11.

小号手迈尔斯·戴维斯：这段引文出自亚当·沙茨对约翰·斯威德所著《那又怎样：迈尔斯·戴维斯的一生》（西蒙与舒斯特出版社，2002年）的书评。该书评发表于2002年12月29日《纽约时报》周日书评版，第11页。

George Shultz, in his memoir : See George Shultz, Turmoil and Triumph: My Years as Secretary of State (Charles Scribner’s Sons, 1995), p. 763.

乔治·舒尔茨在他的回忆录中写道：参见乔治·舒尔茨，《动荡与胜利：我担任国务卿的岁月》（查尔斯·斯克里布纳之子出版社，1995 年），第 763 页。

“ It is not enough to be ”: See Frank Barrett, “Creativity and Improvisation in Jazz and Organizations: Implications for Organizational Learning,” Organization Science 9, no. 5 (September–October 1998): pp. 605–22, at 617. Most of what I have learned about improvising, I’ve learned from Frank.

“仅仅存在是不够的”：参见 Frank Barrett，“爵士乐和组织中的创造力和即兴创作：对组织学习的启示”，《组织科学》9，第 5 期（1998 年 9 月至 10 月）：第 605-22 页，第 617 页。我所学到的关于即兴创作的大部分知识都来自 Frank。

According to Barrett : See Frank Barrett, Yes to the Mess: Surprising Leadership Lessons from Jazz (Harvard Business Review Press, 2012), p. 175.

根据巴雷特的说法：参见弗兰克·巴雷特，《接受混乱：爵士乐中令人惊讶的领导力教训》（哈佛商业评论出版社，2012 年），第 175 页。

“ He’s yakking and talking” : See Sally Abrahms, “Richard Holbrooke Receives the Great Negotiator Award,” Harvard Law Today , January 2005, p. 1. A summary of that article appears at http://www.law.harvard.edu/news/bulletin/2005/fall/feature-intro.php .

“他喋喋不休，滔滔不绝”：参见 Sally Abrahms，“Richard Holbrooke 荣获伟大的谈判家奖”，《哈佛法律今日》，2005 年 1 月，第 1 页。该文章的摘要见 http://www.law.harvard.edu/news/bulletin/2005/fall/feature-intro.php。

“ provocative competence” : For more on this theme, see Barrett, chap. 7, “Leadership as Provocative Competence,” in Yes to the Mess , pp. 135–60.

“挑衅性能力”：有关此主题的更多信息，请参阅 Barrett 的第 7 章“作为挑衅性能力的领导力”，载于《Yes to the Mess》第 135-160 页。

Saxophonist John Coltrane : See Barrett, “Creativity and Improvisation,” pp. 605–22, at 609.

萨克斯管演奏家约翰·科尔特兰：参见巴雷特，《创造力和即兴创作》，第 605-22 页，第 609 页。

Benny Goodman’s famed Carnegie Hall : This performance and Phil Schaap’s commentary can be seen at the beginning of episode six, “Swing: The Velocity of Celebration—1937–1939,” in the Ken Burns 2001 documentary series Jazz .

本尼·古德曼著名的卡内基音乐厅：这段表演和菲尔·沙普的评论可以在肯·伯恩斯 2001 年纪录片系列《爵士乐》第六集“摇摆：庆祝的速度——1937-1939”的开头看到。

Fear of mistakes is a great inhibitor : The quotations in these two paragraphs from Stephen Nachmanovitch’s Free Play: Improvisation in Life and Art (Jeremy P. Tarcher/Putnam, 1990) are from p. 52 and p. 64, respectively.

害怕犯错是一个很大的阻碍：这两段引文分别出自 Stephen Nachmanovitch 的《自由游戏：生活和艺术中的即兴创作》（Jeremy P. Tarcher/Putnam，1990 年），分别来自第 52 页和第 64 页。

Ed Sarath, former head : Ed Sarath examines the essential interplay between, and value of, working within and beyond one’s comfort zone in Improvisation, Creativity, and Consciousness: Jazz as an Integral Template for Music, Education, and Society (SUNY Press, 2013). Using concepts from music theory, he shows how probing unfamiliar territory breaks down normative cognitive structures, and, in so doing, gives rise to new conceptual and creative possibilities.

前任负责人埃德·萨拉斯：埃德·萨拉斯在其著作《即兴创作、创造力与意识：爵士乐作为音乐、教育与社会的综合模板》（纽约州立大学出版社，2013年）中探讨了在舒适区内外工作的重要性及其价值。他运用音乐理论的概念，展示了探索未知领域如何打破既定的认知结构，并在此过程中催生新的概念和创造可能性。

“ I don’t like a comfortable person” : The quotation is from the 2002 documentary The Miles Davis Story, available at http://www.amazon.com/Miles-Davis-Story-George-Avakian/dp/B00007CVRL/ref=sr_1_1?s=movies-tv&ie=UTF8&qid=1363360526&sr=1-1&keywords=miles+davis+story .

“我不喜欢安于现状的人”：这句话出自 2002 年的纪录片《迈尔斯·戴维斯的故事》，可在以下网址观看：http://www.amazon.com/Miles-Davis-Story-George-Avakian/dp/B00007CVRL/ref=sr_1_1?s=movies-tv&ie=UTF8&qid=1363360526&sr=1-1&keywords=miles+davis+story。

“ You better have something to play” : See Paul Berliner, Thinking in Jazz: The Infinite Art of Improvisation (University of Chicago Press, 1994), p. 102.

“你最好准备些东西来演奏”：参见保罗·柏林纳，《爵士乐的思考：即兴创作的无限艺术》（芝加哥大学出版社，1994 年），第 102 页。

Donald Dell tells about : See Donald Dell with John Boswell, Never Make the First Offer , p. 38.

唐纳德·戴尔讲述：参见唐纳德·戴尔与约翰·博斯韦尔合著的《永远不要先出价》，第 38 页。

Long before Dick Costolo became : See Nick Bilton, “A Master of Improv, Writing Twitter’s Script ,” New York Times , Business Section, October 7, 2012, p. 1.

早在迪克·科斯托洛成为……之前，请参阅尼克·比尔顿的文章《即兴大师，推特的剧本》，载于《纽约时报》商业版，2012 年 10 月 7 日，第 1 页。

Bill Ury’s 2007 book : See William Ury, The Power of a Positive No: Save the Deal, Save the Relationship—And Still Say No (Bantam Books, 2007).

比尔·尤里 2007 年出版的著作：参见威廉·尤里，《积极拒绝的力量：挽救交易，挽救关系——并仍然说不》（Bantam Books，2007 年）。

And the power of having that attitude : See Alison Wood Brooks, “Get Excited: Reappraising Pre-Performance Anxiety as Excitement” (unpublished doctoral thesis, the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania, 2013).

而拥有这种态度的力量：参见 Alison Wood Brooks 的文章“兴奋起来：将赛前焦虑重新评估为兴奋”（宾夕法尼亚大学沃顿商学院未发表的博士论文，2013 年）。

Gerry Williams, a pioneer in the negotiation field : Gerry was a pioneer in negotiation research and teaching. He is now an emeritus professor at Brigham Young University.

格里·威廉姆斯，谈判领域的先驱：格里是谈判研究和教学领域的先驱。他现在是杨百翰大学的荣誉退休教授。

An Appreciative Mind-Set : For more on this theme, see Barrett, chap. 8, “Getting to ‘Yes to the Mess,’ ” in Yes to the Mess , pp. 161–84.

欣赏的心态：有关此主题的更多信息，请参阅 Barrett 的《接受混乱》第 8 章“接受混乱”，第 161-184 页。

The late investment banker : See Laurence Grafstein, “M&A . . . and Bruce,” New Republic , October 15, 2009; www.newrepublic.com/article/economy/ma-%E2%80%A6-and-bruce .

已故投资银行家：参见 Laurence Grafstein，“并购……和布鲁斯”，《新共和》，2009 年 10 月 15 日；www.newrepublic.com/article/economy/ma-%E2%80%A6-and-bruce。

Several years ago : See David Hajdu, “Wynton’s Blues,” Atlantic Monthly , March 2003, pp. 43–55.

几年前：参见 David Hajdu，“Wynton’s Blues”，《大西洋月刊》，2003 年 3 月，第 43-55 页。

Chapter 7: Situational Awareness

第七章：情境意识

It took the maverick intelligence : Material on Colonel Boyd in this chapter is drawn from several sources, including Robert Coram, Boyd: The Fighter Pilot Who Changed the Art of War (Little, Brown and Company, 2002); Grant Hammond, The Mind of War: John Boyd and American Security (Smithsonian Institution, 2001); and Frans Osinga, Science, Strategy, and War: The Strategic Theory of John Boyd (Routledge, 2006). For further examination of the links between military doctrine and negotiation strategy, see Michael Wheeler, “The Fog of Negotiation: What Negotiators Can Learn from Military Doctrine,” Negotiation Journal 29, no. 1 (January 2013): pp. 23–38.

这需要特立独行的智慧：本章关于博伊德上校的资料取材于多部著作，包括罗伯特·科拉姆的《博伊德：改变战争艺术的战斗机飞行员》（利特尔-布朗出版社，2002年）；格兰特·哈蒙德的《战争的思维：约翰·博伊德与美国安全》（史密森学会，2001年）；以及弗朗斯·奥辛加的《科学、战略与战争：约翰·博伊德的战略理论》（劳特利奇出版社，2006年）。关于军事理论与谈判策略之间联系的进一步探讨，请参见迈克尔·惠勒的《谈判的迷雾：谈判者可以从军事理论中学到什么》，载于《谈判杂志》第29卷第1期（2013年1月），第23-38页。

Former Israeli prime minister Shimon Peres : See Michael Benoliel with Linda Cashdan, Done Deal: Insights from Interviews with the World’s Best Negotiators (Platinum Press, 2005), p. 127.

以色列前总理西蒙·佩雷斯：参见迈克尔·贝诺利尔与琳达·卡什丹合著的《成交：世界最佳谈判者的访谈录》（Platinum Press，2005 年），第 127 页。

US Marine Corps doctrine defines: Warfighting , Marine Corps Doctrinal Publication 1, U.S. Marine Corps, rev. ed. (June 1997), p. 95. Hereafter cited as Warfighting . The manual can be found online on various sites, including, as of this writing, www.fs.fed.us/fire/doctrine/genesis_and_evolution/source_materials/MCDP-1_warfighting.pdf . The fact that it is publicly accessible suggests that the success of strategy depends on how well it is executed.

美国海军陆战队条令对“作战”一词进行了定义：《海军陆战队条令出版物1：作战》，美国海军陆战队，修订版（1997年6月），第95页。以下简称“作战”。该手册可在多个网站上找到，截至撰写本文时，例如www.fs.fed.us/fire/doctrine/genesis_and_evolution/source_materials/MCDP-1_warfighting.pdf。该手册的公开获取表明，战略的成功取决于其执行的有效性。

“Machines don’t fight wars”: Boyd is quoted in Raymond Curts and Douglas Campbell, “Avoiding Information Overload Through the Understanding of OODA Loops, A Cognitive Hierarchy and Object-Oriented Analysis and Design,” Proceedings of the 2001 Command and Control Research and Technology Symposium , U.S. Naval Academy (June 2001). Boyd gave many presentations. He apparently expressed this idea in a variety of ways. One website ( www.oocities.org/heratyk/milquote1.html#b ) cites him as saying both “People, ideas, and hardware—in that order!” and “Machines don’t fight wars. People do, and they use their minds.”

“机器不打仗”：博伊德的这句话出自雷蒙德·柯茨和道格拉斯·坎贝尔合著的《通过理解OODA循环、认知层级和面向对象分析与设计来避免信息过载》，该文发表于2001年美国海军学院指挥与控制研究技术研讨会论文集（2001年6月）。博伊德曾多次发表演讲，显然他以多种方式表达过这一观点。一个网站（www.oocities.org/heratyk/milquote1.html#b）引用他的话，既有“人、思想和硬件——按这个顺序！”，也有“机器不打仗，人打仗，而且人要运用他们的智慧。”

In the seeming chaos : See Hammond, Mind of War , p. 32.

在看似混乱的局面中：参见哈蒙德，《战争的思维》，第 32 页。

Erin Egan was merely : Erin is a former student of mine. I appreciate her generosity in allowing me to describe her negotiation experiences.

艾琳·伊根只是：艾琳是我以前的学生。我很感谢她慷慨地允许我描述她的谈判经历。

Researchers call what : See Karl Weick, Sensemaking in Organizations (Sage Publications, 1995); Weick and Kathleen Sutcliffe, chap. 6, “How to Manage Mindfully,” in Managing the Unexpected: Resilient Performance in an Age of Uncertainty (Jossey-Bass, 2007), pp. 149–73; and Coutu, ““Sense and Reliability,” p. 86.

研究人员称之为：参见 Karl Weick，《组织中的意义建构》（Sage Publications，1995 年）；Weick 和 Kathleen Sutcliffe，《管理意外：不确定时代的韧性绩效》（Jossey-Bass，2007 年）第 6 章“如何用心管理”，第 149-173 页；以及 Coutu，“‘意义和可靠性’”，第 86 页。

In basketball, it’s called : See Jackie MacMullan, “Cousy Getting to Point: New Award Honors Best College Guard,” Boston Globe , June 26, 2003, p. C-8.

在篮球中，它被称为：参见 Jackie MacMullan，“Cousy Getting to Point: New Award Honors Best College Guard”，《波士顿环球报》，2003 年 6 月 26 日，第 C-8 页。

A clever experiment : This study is cited in Sheena Iyengar, The Art of Choosing (Twelve, 2010), p. 193.

一项巧妙的实验：这项研究被 Sheena Iyengar 引用，《选择的艺术》（Twelve，2010 年），第 193 页。

Chess writer and chess master Graham Burgess : See Graham Burgess , The Quickest Chess Victories of All Time (Cadogan, 1998), p. 4.

国际象棋作家兼国际象棋大师格雷厄姆·伯吉斯：参见格雷厄姆·伯吉斯，《有史以来最快的国际象棋胜利》（卡多根出版社，1998 年），第 4 页。

As Graham reflects : See Burgess , Quickest Chess Victories , p. 5.

正如格雷厄姆所反思的那样：参见伯吉斯，《最快的国际象棋胜利》，第 5 页。

Newly hatched chicks : See David Myers, Intuition: Its Powers and Perils (Yale University Press, 2002), p. 54.

刚孵出的小鸡：参见 David Myers，《直觉：它的力量和危险》（耶鲁大学出版社，2002 年），第 54 页。

They speak of identifying : See Warfighting, pp. 92–93.

他们谈到识别：参见《战争》，第 92-93 页。

In Streetlights and Shadows: See Gary Klein, Streetlights and Shadows: Searching for the Keys to Adaptive Decision Making (MIT Press, 2009), p. 153.

参见 Gary Klein 的《路灯与阴影：寻找适应性决策的关键》（麻省理工学院出版社，2009 年），第 153 页。

Consider, for example, this exchange : For an analysis of this case, see www.airdisaster.com/special/special-af90.shtml . Although more than thirty years old, the transcript is still used in training flight crews and other teams where clear communication is essential.

例如，请看以下对话：有关此案例的分析，请访问 www.airdisaster.com/special/special-af90.shtml。尽管这份记录已有三十多年历史，但至今仍用于培训飞行机组人员和其他需要清晰沟通的团队。

Contrast the Potomac case : For excerpts of the radio communication between Captain Sullenberger and flight control, see Sharon Otterman and Matthew Wald, “F.A.A. Releases Flight 1549 Tapes,” New York Times , City Room , February 5, 2009, http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/02/05/faa-releases-flight-1549-tapes-2 .

与波托马克事件形成对比：有关萨伦伯格机长与飞行控制中心之间的无线电通信摘录，请参阅 Sharon Otterman 和 Matthew Wald，“FAA 公布 1549 号航班录音带”，《纽约时报》城市版，2009 年 2 月 5 日，http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/02/05/faa-releases-flight-1549-tapes-2。

He wasted no time : In the year after Sullenberger’s water landing, analysts tested different flight simulator models to see if he actually could have piloted his crippled plane back to LaGuardia. See Andy Pasztor, “ ‘Hudson Miracle’ Gets Closer Look,” Wall Street Journal , May 4, 2010. Studying all the data, a few researchers now believe that he might have made it back safely. That’s a big “might,” however, as even some of them concede that it’s uncertain whether he could have cleared high-rises in Midtown Manhattan. In any event, the pilot had only a couple of minutes, not months, to weigh his options. He simply had the instrument readings right in front of him.

他没有浪费时间：在萨伦伯格水上迫降后的一年里，分析人士测试了不同的飞行模拟器模型，以验证他是否真的能够驾驶那架受损的飞机返回拉瓜迪亚机场。参见安迪·帕斯托尔的文章《“哈德逊河奇迹”的深入探究》，载于《华尔街日报》，2010年5月4日。通过研究所有数据，一些研究人员现在认为他或许能够安全返回。然而，这只是一个“或许”，因为即使是他们中的一些人也承认，他是否能够飞越曼哈顿中城的摩天大楼尚不确定。无论如何，这位飞行员只有几分钟而不是几个月的时间来权衡各种选择。他面前只有清晰的仪表读数。

In their book Make Your Own Luck: See Eileen Shapiro and Howard Stevenson, Make Your Own Luck: 12 Practical Steps to Taking Smarter Risks in Business (Portfolio, 2005), p. 10.

在他们的著作《创造你自己的运气》中：参见 Eileen Shapiro 和 Howard Stevenson 合著的《创造你自己的运气：在商业中采取更明智的风险的 12 个实用步骤》（Portfolio，2005 年），第 10 页。

Psychological research : See Amos Tversky and Daniel Kahneman, “Loss Aversion in Riskless Choice: A Reference-Dependent Model,” Quarterly Journal of Economics 106, no. 4 (November 1991), pp. 1039–61.

心理学研究：参见 Amos Tversky 和 Daniel Kahneman，“无风险选择中的损失厌恶：参考依赖模型”，《经济学季刊》106，第 4 期（1991 年 11 月），第 1039-61 页。

Vacillation is a cardinal sin : See David Freedman, Corps Business: The 30 Management Principles of the U.S. Marines (HarperBusiness, 2001), p. 7.

犹豫不决是不可饶恕的罪过：参见 David Freedman，《军团事务：美国海军陆战队的 30 项管理原则》（HarperBusiness，2001 年），第 7 页。

A player looking forward : See Gary Kasparov’s review of Chess Metaphors: Artificial Language and the Human Mind in the New York Review of Books , February 11, 2010.

一位展望未来的棋手：请参阅加里·卡斯帕罗夫在 2010 年 2 月 11 日《纽约书评》上对《国际象棋隐喻：人工语言与人类思维》的评论。

Having a bump plan : Freedman, Corps Business , p. 182.

制定应急计划：弗里德曼，《军团事务》，第 182 页。

Academy Award winner : Russell Crowe’s comment is from an interview on Inside the Actors Studio , which aired January 4, 2004.

奥斯卡奖得主：罗素·克劳的评论出自 2004 年 1 月 4 日播出的《演员工作室》节目中的一次采访。

Stirring the pot : Colonel Boyd never wrote a book—or even an article, apparently—on his theories, but he did amass an ever-growing set of overheads that he used in his presentations. It was entitled “Patterns of Conflict” and is available (in different versions) on the web, including in the bibliography for the Wikipedia entry for “Patterns of Conflict.” Boyd’s characterization of the early military theories of Napoléon I appears on page 37 of that version of the material.

搅动风云：博伊德上校从未就其理论撰写过书籍——甚至连文章也没有——但他确实积累了一套不断增长的幻灯片，用于他的演讲。这套幻灯片名为《冲突模式》，可以在网上找到（有不同版本），包括维基百科“冲突模式”词条的参考文献中也有收录。博伊德对拿破仑一世早期军事理论的描述出现在该版本资料的第37页。

Jenny Rudolph conducts research : Dr. Rudolph’s work is summarized and extended in J. Rudolph, J. B. Morrison, and J. Carroll, “The Dynamics of Action-Oriented Problem Solving: Linking Interpretation and Choice,” Academy of Management Review 34, no. 4 (October 2009): 733–56. It was based on Dr. Rudolph’s doctoral dissertation conducted at the Center for Medical Simulation (CMS).

Jenny Rudolph 进行研究：Rudolph 博士的研究成果在 J. Rudolph、J. B. Morrison 和 J. Carroll 合著的《行动导向问题解决的动态：解释与选择的联系》一文中进行了总结和扩展，该文发表于《管理学会评论》第 34 卷第 4 期（2009 年 10 月）：733-756 页。该研究基于 Rudolph 博士在医学模拟中心 (CMS) 完成的博士论文。

French philosopher : I came upon Émile Chartier’s aphorism in David Ullman’s article, “ ‘OO-OO-OO!’ The Sound of a Broken OODA Loop,” CrossTalk: The Journal of Defense Software Engineering 20, no. 4 (April 2007): pp. 22–25, at 23.

法国哲学家：我在 David Ullman 的文章“‘OO-OO-OO！’ OODA 循环崩溃的声音”中偶然发现了 Émile Chartier 的格言，该文章发表于《CrossTalk：国防软件工程杂志》第 20 卷第 4 期（2007 年 4 月）第 22-25 页，第 23 页。

A leader who ruled : The Gadafi quotation is from Max Rodenbeck, “Libya: The Losers,” New York Review of Books , October 13, 2011. There are conflicting stories of how Gadafi died, though video suggests strongly that he was killed by rebel forces.

一位统治者：卡扎菲的这段引文出自马克斯·罗登贝克的《利比亚：失败者》，载于《纽约书评》，2011年10月13日。关于卡扎菲的死因众说纷纭，但视频强烈表明他是被叛军杀害的。

“Plans are worthless ”: The quotation is from an Eisenhower speech to the National Defense Executive Reserve Conference in Washington, DC (November 14, 1957), in Public Papers of the Presidents of the United States, Dwight D. Eisenhower, 1957 , National Archives and Records Service, Government Printing Office (1958), p. 818.

“计划毫无价值”：这句话出自艾森豪威尔在华盛顿特区举行的国家国防行政后备队会议上的演讲（1957 年 11 月 14 日），载于《美国总统公共文件集》，德怀特·D·艾森豪威尔，1957 年，国家档案馆和记录服务处，政府印刷局（1958 年），第 818 页。

The further ahead we think : See Warfighting, pp. 83–84.

我们思考得越远：参见战争，第 83-84 页。

“ The task denotes ”: See Warfighting, p. 89.

“任务意味着”：参见《战争》，第 89 页。

Karl Weick : See Klein, Intuition at Work , pp. 200–7. Klein notes a dilemma in crafting instructions. “The art in describing your intent,” he says, “is to give as little information as you can. The more details you pack in, the more you obscure your main points. But if you leave out an important consideration, you run the risk that the person will be confused at a critical decision point.”

卡尔·韦克：参见克莱因，《直觉在工作中》，第200-207页。克莱因指出，编写指令时存在一个两难困境。他说：“描述意图的艺术在于尽可能少地提供信息。细节越多，就越容易掩盖要点。但如果你遗漏了重要的考量因素，就可能导致对方在关键决策点感到困惑。”

On June 5, 1944, the eve of the Normandy landings : To view General Eisenhower’s full message and to hear an audio recording, see www.army.mil/d-day/message.html .

1944 年 6 月 5 日，诺曼底登陆前夕：要查看艾森豪威尔将军的完整讲话并收听录音，请访问 www.army.mil/d-day/message.html。

Tucked into his wallet : To view General Eisenhower’s handwritten note, see www.archives.gov/education/lessons/d-day-message .

他的钱包里夹着：要查看艾森豪威尔将军的手写便条，请访问 www.archives.gov/education/lessons/d-day-message。

In 1997, Marine Corps : See Counterinsurgency , FM 3-24 (Washington, DC), Department of the Army, December 2006), p. 8–3.

1997 年，海军陆战队：参见《反叛乱》，FM 3-24（华盛顿特区），陆军部，2006 年 12 月），第 8-3 页。

In 2007, Major Leonard Lira : See Leonard Lira, chap. 27, “Design: The US Army’s Approach to Negotiating Wicked Problems,” in Venturing Beyond the Classroom , Vol. 2 in the Rethinking Negotiation Teaching series, eds. Christopher Honeyman, James Coben, and Giuseppe De Palo (DRI Press, 2011), pp. 511–28, at 519.

2007 年，伦纳德·利拉少校：参见伦纳德·利拉，第 27 章，“设计：美国陆军应对棘手问题的谈判方法”，载于《走出课堂》，《重新思考谈判教学》系列第 2 卷，克里斯托弗·霍尼曼、詹姆斯·科本和朱塞佩·德·帕洛编辑（DRI 出版社，2011 年），第 511-528 页，第 519 页。

Lira had initially organized forums : From recent correspondence with Leonard Lira.

Lira 最初组织过论坛：摘自最近与 Leonard Lira 的通信。

Lira turned to other : See, for example, Jack Kem, Design: Tools of the Trade , Fort Leavenworth, KS: US Army Command and Staff College (May 2009), http://usacac.army.mil/cac2/repository/Materials/Design.pdf ; see also Peter Checkland and John Poulter, Learning for Action: A Short Definitive Account of Soft Systems Methodology, and its Use for Practitioners, Teachers, and Students (Wiley, 2006).

Lira 转而参考其他资料：例如，参见 Jack Kem，《设计：行业工具》，堪萨斯州莱文沃思堡：美国陆军指挥与参谋学院（2009 年 5 月），http://usacac.army.mil/cac2/repository/Materials/Design.pdf；另见 Peter Checkland 和 John Poulter，《行动学习：软系统方法论及其在实践者、教师和学生中的应用简明权威说明》（Wiley，2006 年）。

This change in negotiation strategy : See Chris Argyris and Donald Schon, Organization Learning: A Theory of Action Perspective (Addison-Wesley, 1978); Donald Schon, The Reflective Practitioner (Basic Books, 1983); and Chris Argyris, “Teaching Smart People How to Learn,” Harvard Business Review , May–June, 1991, pp. 99–109.

谈判策略的这种变化：参见 Chris Argyris 和 Donald Schon 的《组织学习：行动理论视角》（Addison-Wesley，1978 年）；Donald Schon 的《反思型实践者》（Basic Books，1983 年）；以及 Chris Argyris 的《教聪明人如何学习》，《哈佛商业评论》，1991 年 5 月至 6 月，第 99-109 页。

In 2003, in the early days : For more on the incident that follows, see Dan Baum, “Annals of War: Battle Lessons—What the General Don’t Know,” New Yorker , January 17, 2005, pp. 42–48. See also chap. 3, “The Mosque of Ali,” in Christopher Hughes, War on Two Fronts: An Infantry Commander’s War in Iraq and the Pentagon (Casemate, 2007).

2003 年，在初期：有关接下来事件的更多信息，请参阅 Dan Baum 的文章“战争编年史：战斗教训——将军不知道的事”，载于《纽约客》，2005 年 1 月 17 日，第 42-48 页。另请参阅 Christopher Hughes 的著作《两线作战：一名步兵指挥官在伊拉克和五角大楼的战争》（Casemate 出版社，2007 年）第 3 章“阿里清真寺”。

Part 3: Managing the Process

第三部分：流程管理

Consider Northern Ireland : Senator Mitchell has frequently mentioned the two years of “failure” and one day of negotiation success in Northern Ireland. This specific comment was made at an INSS Conference in Tel-Aviv, Israel, December 18, 2008, “Security Challenges of the 21st Century: The US and Israeli Roles in the Middle East Under Changing Political Circumstances.” It appears on page 8 of the transcript.

以北爱尔兰为例：米切尔参议员曾多次提及北爱尔兰谈判两年来的“失败”以及仅有的一天成功。这一评论出自2008年12月18日在以色列特拉维夫举行的国际安全研究所（INSS）会议，会议主题为“21世纪的安全挑战：不断变化的政治环境下美国和以色列在中东的角色”。该评论出现在会议记录的第8页。

Chapter 8: Openings

第八章：开场

We videotaped real estate professionals : The tapes (titled “Negotiation of a Commercial Lease”) and a related negotiation exercise are available from the Program on Negotiation’s case clearinghouse: www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/category/audio-cd/?sort=custom

我们对房地产专业人士进行了录像：这些录像（标题为“商业租赁谈判”）以及相关的谈判练习可在谈判项目案例库中获取：www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/category/audio-cd/?sort=custom

Amy, a social psychologist : For an introduction to her work, see Amy Cuddy, Peter Glick, and Anna Beninger, “The Dynamics of Warmth and Competence Judgments, and Their Outcomes in Organizations,” Research in Organizational Behavior 31 (2011): pp. 73–98; and Cuddy, Glick, and Susan T. Fiske, “Universal Dimensions of Social Cognition: Warmth and Competence,” Trends in Cognitive Science 11, no. 2 (February 2007): pp. 77–83.

社会心理学家艾米：有关她的工作的介绍，请参阅 Amy Cuddy、Peter Glick 和 Anna Beninger 合著的《温暖和能力判断的动态及其在组织中的结果》，载于《组织行为研究》31 (2011)，第 73-98 页；以及 Cuddy、Glick 和 Susan T. Fiske 合著的《社会认知的普遍维度：温暖和能力》，载于《认知科学趋势》11，第 2 期（2007 年 2 月），第 77-83 页。

Amy and her colleagues : See Dana Carney, Amy Cuddy, and Andy Yap, “Power Posing: Brief Nonverbal Displays Affect Neuroendocrine Levels and Risk Tolerance,” Psychological Science 21, no. 10 (October 2010): pp. 1363–68.

Amy 和她的同事：参见 Dana Carney、Amy Cuddy 和 Andy Yap，“权力姿势：短暂的非语言展示影响神经内分泌水平和风险承受能力”，《心理科学》21，第 10 期（2010 年 10 月）：第 1363-68 页。

Opening up your physical stance : See Amy’s 2012 TED talk “Your Body Language Shapes Who You Are,” www.ted.com/talks/amy_cuddy_your_body_language_shapes_who_you_are.html .

打开你的身体姿态：请观看 Amy 2012 年的 TED 演讲“你的肢体语言塑造了你”，www.ted.com/talks/amy_cuddy_your_body_language_shapes_who_you_are.html。

On September 16, 2001 : Courtney Cowart spoke at a Kennedy School of Government forum on rebuilding the World Trade Center. The event was held on October 7, 2002.

2001年9月16日：考特尼·考沃特在肯尼迪政府学院关于重建世界贸易中心的论坛上发表了讲话。该活动于2002年10月7日举行。

Chapter 9: Critical Moments

第九章：关键时刻

Daniel Yin was back : A set of cases that I have developed tell the following story in greater detail. They are available from Harvard Business School Publishing and are entitled Kidnapping Negotiation , A through D, product numbers 899026 through 899029, August 16, 2000.

丹尼尔·尹回来了：我编写的一系列案例更详细地讲述了以下故事。这些案例由哈佛商学院出版社出版，书名为《绑架谈判》，A至D卷，产品编号为899026至899029，出版日期为2000年8月16日。

He triages : His comment was made during a seminar that was held when he received PON’s Great Negotiator Award in 2002. Video of the event is available from the Program’s Clearinghouse: www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2 .

他进行分类：他的这番话是在 2002 年他获得 PON 的“伟大谈判者奖”时举办的一次研讨会上说的。该活动的视频可从该项目的信息中心获取：www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2。

Bill describes this technique : See Ury, The Power of a Positive No .

比尔描述了这种技巧：参见 Ury 的《积极数字的力量》。

For years, the Humane Society : From an NPR Morning Edition interview and story by Steve Inskeep, “How Two Bitter Adversaries Hatched a Plan to Change the Egg Business,” February 10, 2012, www.npr.org/templates/rundowns/rundown.php?prgId=3&prgDate=2-10-2012 .

多年来，人道协会：摘自 NPR Morning Edition 对 Steve Inskeep 的采访和报道，“两个死对头如何策划改变鸡蛋行业的计划”，2012 年 2 月 10 日，www.npr.org/templates/rundowns/rundown.php?prgId=3&prgDate=2-10-2012。

According to the New York Times: See New York Times , January 22, 2009.

据《纽约时报》报道：参见《纽约时报》2009 年 1 月 22 日报道。

Lisa Tschorn was meeting : Lisa Tschorn is a pseudonym.

Lisa Tschorn 正在会面：Lisa Tschorn 是化名。

What’s the best way : Deborah Kolb and Judith Williams, chap. 3, “Resisting Challenges,” in Everyday Negotiation: Navigating the Hidden Agendas in Bargaining (Jossey-Bass, 2003).

最好的方法是什么？参见 Deborah Kolb 和 Judith Williams 合著的《日常谈判：驾驭谈判中的隐藏议程》（Jossey-Bass 出版社，2003 年）第 3 章“抵制挑战”。

Kolb and Williams call dances : See Deborah Kolb and Judith Williams, The Shadow Negotiation: How Women Can Master the Hidden Agendas That Determine Bargaining Success (Simon & Schuster, 2000).

Kolb 和 Williams 称之为舞蹈：参见 Deborah Kolb 和 Judith Williams 合著的《影子谈判：女性如何掌握决定谈判成功的隐藏议程》（西蒙与舒斯特出版社，2000 年）。

Bill Gates and Steve Jobs : See Walter Isaacson, Steve Jobs (Simon & Schuster, 2011), pp. 177–79.

比尔·盖茨和史蒂夫·乔布斯：参见沃尔特·艾萨克森，《史蒂夫·乔布斯》（西蒙与舒斯特出版社，2011 年），第 177-179 页。

Years ago, a young comic : This story is from an On the Record with Bob Costas interview with Larry David that aired on HBO in 2003.

多年前，一位年轻的喜剧演员：这个故事来自鲍勃·科斯塔斯 (Bob Costas) 于 2003 年在 HBO 播出的《On the Record with Bob Costas》节目对拉里·大卫 (Larry David) 的采访。

Chapter 10: Closing

第十章：结尾

That kind of lore : For solid advice, see G. Richard Shell and Mario Moussa, The Art of Woo: Using Strategic Persuasion to Sell Your Ideas (Penguin Books, 2008); Robert Cialdini, Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion (HarperBusiness, 2006), and his more recent Yes! 50 Scientifically Proven Ways to Be Persuasive (with Noah J. Goldstein and Steve J. Martin, Free Press, 2008); and Deepak Malhotra and Max Bazerman, chap. 7, “Strategies of Influence,” in Negotiation Genius: How to Overcome Obstacles and Achieve Brilliant Results at the Bargaining Table and Beyond (Bantam Books, 2007).

这类经验之谈：如需可靠的建议，请参阅 G. Richard Shell 和 Mario Moussa 合著的《说服的艺术：运用战略说服力推销你的想法》（企鹅出版社，2008 年）；Robert Cialdini 的《影响力：说服心理学》（哈珀商业出版社，2006 年），以及他最近出版的《是的！50 种经科学验证的说服方法》（与 Noah J. Goldstein 和 Steve J. Martin 合著，自由出版社，2008 年）；以及 Deepak Malhotra 和 Max Bazerman 合著的《谈判天才：如何在谈判桌内外克服障碍并取得卓越成果》（班塔姆出版社，2007 年）第七章“影响力策略”。

Sheena Iyengar : For a provocative analysis about how freedom of choice is valued differently in various cultures, see Iyengar, Art of Choosing .

希娜·艾扬格：想要了解关于不同文化中对选择自由的重视程度的深刻分析，请参阅艾扬格的《选择的艺术》。

Former New York City detective : See Diane Coutu, “Negotiating Without a Net: A Conversation with the NYPD’s Dominick J. Misino,” Harvard Business Review , October 2002, pp. 49–54.

前纽约市侦探：参见 Diane Coutu，“没有安全网的谈判：与纽约市警察局的 Dominick J. Misino 的对话”，《哈佛商业评论》，2002 年 10 月，第 49-54 页。

The sale of a $3 million : For these examples of difficult real estate closings, see Patrick O’Gilfoil Healy, “Closing Day Disasters,” New York Times , April 24, 2012, p. 1.

一笔价值 300 万美元的房产交易：有关这些困难的房地产交易完成的例子，请参阅 Patrick O’Gilfoil Healy，“交易日灾难”，《纽约时报》，2012 年 4 月 24 日，第 1 页。

A young couple : See Elaine McCardle, “The Personal Touch: More Homebuyers Are Writing Letters to Sellers to Personalize, Help Seal the Sale,” Boston Globe , April 25, 2004, pp. G-1 and G-4.

一对年轻夫妇：参见 Elaine McCardle，“个性化服务：越来越多的购房者给卖家写信，以个性化服务，帮助促成交易”，《波士顿环球报》，2004 年 4 月 25 日，第 G-1 和 G-4 页。

Relationships matter : See Weintraub, When I Stop Talking, pp. 89–90.

人际关系很重要：参见 Weintraub 的《当我停止说话时》，第 89-90 页。

We’ll close with another : Derek Sanderson generously shared this story with me. He describes his salary negotiations—and other aspects of his remarkable life—in Crossing the Line: The Outrageous Story of a Hockey Original , coauthored with Kevin Shea (Triumph Books, 2012).

最后，我们再分享一个故事：德里克·桑德森慷慨地与我分享了这个故事。他在与凯文·谢伊合著的《越界：一位冰球传奇人物的惊人故事》（Triumph Books出版社，2012年）一书中，描述了他的薪资谈判经历以及他非凡人生的其他方面。

Part 4: Mastery

第四部分：精通

You need, I think : Brahimi made this comment during a seminar when he received the Program on Negotiation’s Great Negotiator Award in 2002. Video of the event is available from the Program’s Clearinghouse: www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2 .

我认为你需要：布拉希米在 2002 年获得谈判项目颁发的“伟大谈判家奖”时，在一次研讨会上发表了这番评论。该活动的视频可从该项目的信息中心获取：www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2。

Chapter 11: Silk Purses

第十一章：丝绸钱包

A major publishing house : George Brockway, the former president of W. W. Norton, told me this story.

一家大型出版社：W. W. Norton 出版社前总裁乔治·布罗克韦 (George Brockway) 给我讲了这个故事。

In the 1990s : See George Gendron, “Real Men Don’t Litigate,” Inc ., May 1, 1992, www.inc.com/magazine/1992050 1 / 4 059.html. Southwest posted a video of the contest on YouTube: www.youtube.com/watch?v=EwU9m4oCtRE .

20 世纪 90 年代：参见 George Gendron，“真正的男人不打官司”，《Inc.》杂志，1992 年 5 月 1 日，www.inc.com/magazine/1992050 1 / 4 059.html。西南航空在 YouTube 上发布了该比赛的视频：www.youtube.com/watch?v=EwU9m4oCtRE。

Recent studies by Evan Polman : See Evan Polman and Kyle J. Emich, “Decisions for Others Are More Creative Than Decisions for the Self,” Personality and Social Psychology Bulletin 37, no. 4 (April 2011): pp. 492–501.

埃文·波尔曼的最新研究：参见埃文·波尔曼和凯尔·J·埃米奇，“为他人做决定比为自己做决定更具创造性”，《人格与社会心理学公报》37，第4期（2011年4月）：第492-501页。

In the movie Heist : See www.imdb.com/title/tt0252503/quotes .

电影《劫匪》：参见 www.imdb.com/title/tt0252503/quotes。

The second puzzle : See Rob Walker, “Take It or Leave It: The Only Guide to Negotiating You Will Ever Need,” Inc. , August 1, 2003, p. 75.

第二个难题：参见 Rob Walker，“要么接受，要么放弃：你唯一需要的谈判指南”，Inc.，2003 年 8 月 1 日，第 75 页。

People who believe : See Max Bazerman, “Negotiator Judgment: A Critical Look at the Rationality Assumption,” American Behavioral Scientist 27, no. 2 (November–December 1983): pp. 211–28, at 215–218.

持此观点的人：参见 Max Bazerman，“谈判者的判断：对理性假设的批判性审视”，《美国行为科学家》27，第 2 期（1983 年 11 月至 12 月）：第 211-228 页，第 215-218 页。

Stephen Nachmanovitch : See Nachmanovitch, Free Play , p. 133.

Stephen Nachmanovitch：参见 Nachmanovitch，《自由游戏》，第 133 页。

The late actress Ruth Gordon : See www.enjoy-your-style.com/ruth-gordon-quotes.html . “To get it right, be born with luck or else make it. Never give up. Get the knack of getting people to help you and also pitch in yourself. A little money helps, but what really gets it right is to never––I repeat––never, under any conditions, face the facts.”

已故女演员露丝·戈登：参见 www.enjoy-your-style.com/ruth-gordon-quotes.html。“要想成功，要么天生幸运，要么努力奋斗。永不放弃。要懂得如何让别人帮助你，自己也要尽一份力。有点钱当然有帮助，但真正成功的秘诀是永远——我再说一遍——永远，在任何情况下，都不要面对现实。”

Claude Lévi-Strauss called it : See Ted Gioia, The Imperfect Art: Reflections on Jazz and Modern Culture (Oxford University Press, 1988), p. 615. Gioia writes: “Like the bricoleur who assumes that there must be a tractor somewhere in that pile of junk, the improviser assumes that there is a melody to be worked out from the morass of rhythms and chord changes.”

克劳德·列维-斯特劳斯称之为：参见泰德·乔亚，《不完美的艺术：爵士乐与现代文化的反思》（牛津大学出版社，1988 年），第 615 页。乔亚写道：“就像一个工匠认为那堆废品里一定有一辆拖拉机一样，即兴演奏者认为可以从混乱的节奏和和弦变化中提炼出一段旋律。”

Unburdened by their bloody history : Holbrooke recounted this story in a panel discussion when he received the Great Negotiator Award in 2004. See Harvard Law Today , January 2005, p. 1. (This is also the source of the Holbrooke reference in the next paragraph.)

霍尔布鲁克在2004年获得“伟大谈判家奖”时，在一个小组讨论会上讲述了这个故事，他并未受到这段血腥历史的束缚。参见《哈佛法律今日》，2005年1月，第1页。（下一段中提到的霍尔布鲁克也出自此处。）

According to Nachmanovitch : See Nachmanovitch, Free Play , p. 43.

根据纳赫马诺维奇的说法：参见纳赫马诺维奇，《自由游戏》，第 43 页。

And spark is the right word : See Andy Clark, Being There: Putting Brain, Body, and World Together Again (MIT Press, 1997), p. 66.

“火花”一词用得恰到好处：参见安迪·克拉克，《身临其境：将大脑、身体和世界重新连接起来》（麻省理工学院出版社，1997 年），第 66 页。

Albert Einstein said that many : See John Kao, Jamming: The Art and Discipline of Business Creativity (HarperCollins, 1996), p. 48.

阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦曾说过：参见约翰·高，《即兴创作：商业创造力的艺术与纪律》（哈珀柯林斯出版社，1996 年），第 48 页。

German scientist Friedrich Kekule : See Myers, Intuition , p. 61.

德国科学家弗里德里希·凯库勒：参见迈尔斯，《直觉》，第 61 页。

When asked how he thought : The Bill Clinton quotation is from the 2006 documentary Wordplay .

当被问及他的想法时：比尔·克林顿的引言出自 2006 年的纪录片《文字游戏》。

Studies by Leigh Thompson : See Dedre Gentner, Jeffrey Loewenstein, Leigh Thompson, and Kenneth Forbus, “Reviving Inert Knowledge: Analogical Abstraction Supports Relational Retrieval of Past Events,” Cognitive Science 33, no. 8 (November–December 2009): pp. 1343–82, which cites the prior studies and related work.

Leigh Thompson 的研究：参见 Dedre Gentner、Jeffrey Loewenstein、Leigh Thompson 和 Kenneth Forbus 的文章“Reviving Inert Knowledge: Analogical Abstraction Supports Relational Retrieval of Past Events”，《认知科学》33，第 8 期（2009 年 11 月至 12 月）：第 1343-82 页，其中引用了先前的研究和相关工作。

Many years ago : See Kim Phillips-Fein, Invisible Hands: The Businessmen’s Crusade Against the New Deal (W. W. Norton & Company, 2010), for a political assessment of Boulware’s tactics.

很多年前：请参阅 Kim Phillips-Fein 的《看不见的手：商界人士反对新政的十字军东征》（W. W. Norton & Company，2010 年），了解对 Boulware 策略的政治评估。

Screenwriter-producer Robert Kosberg : The quotation is from an interview (“The Art of the Pitch”) conducted by Noah Adams on All Things Considered , which aired on NPR on February 19, 1997.

编剧兼制片人罗伯特·科斯伯格：这段引语出自诺亚·亚当斯在 NPR 的《万事皆宜》节目中对他的采访（“推销的艺术”），该节目于 1997 年 2 月 19 日播出。

Babson College professor Lakshmi Balachandra : “Pitching Trustworthiness: Cues for Trust in Early-Sage Investment Decision-Making,” unpublished PhD dissertation at Boston College, 2011.

巴布森学院教授拉克希米·巴拉钱德拉：“推销可信度：早期投资决策中的信任线索”，2011 年在波士顿学院的未发表博士论文。

Skilled psychotherapists have a keen : Laura Abraham, “Can This Marriage Be Saved?,” New York Times Magazine , August 12, 2007, p. 28.

熟练的心理治疗师有敏锐的洞察力：劳拉·亚伯拉罕，《这段婚姻还能挽救吗？》，《纽约时报杂志》，2007 年 8 月 12 日，第 28 页。

When other efforts at peacemaking : My mediator friend who shared this story asked that his name not be used.

当其他调解努力出现时：我的调解员朋友分享了这个故事，他要求不要透露他的姓名。

Chapter 12: Wicked Learning

第十二章：棘手的学习

You can find : To take the test and understand your score, see Schwartz, chap. 4, “When Only the Best Will Do,” in The Paradox of Choice , pp. 77–98, at 80–81.

您可以找到：要参加测试并了解您的分数，请参阅 Schwartz 的《选择的悖论》第 4 章“当只有最好的才能做到时”，第 77-98 页，第 80-81 页。

Robin Hogarth, author : See Robin Hogarth, Educating Intuition (University of Chicago Press, 2001), pp. 89–90.

Robin Hogarth，作者：参见 Robin Hogarth，《培养直觉》（芝加哥大学出版社，2001 年），第 89-90 页。

In the movie : The movie is based on a novel by Barry Reed, The Verdict (Simon & Schuster, 1980).

电影简介：这部电影改编自巴里·里德的小说《判决》（西蒙与舒斯特出版社，1980 年）。

She accepted an $165,000 settlement : See “Blind Student: No Regrets About Taking Lower Malpractice Settlement,” Daytona Beach Morning Journal , March 27, 1975, p. 3A.

她接受了 165,000 美元的和解金：参见《盲人学生：对接受较低的医疗事故和解金不后悔》，《代托纳海滩晨报》，1975 年 3 月 27 日，第 3A 页。

We know that positive things : See Daniel Gilbert, Stumbling on Happiness (Vintage Books, 2005).

我们知道积极的事情：参见丹尼尔·吉尔伯特，《撞上幸福》（Vintage Books，2005）。

Built to Win: See Lawrence Susskind and Hallam Movius, Built to Win: Creating a World-Class Negotiating Organization (Harvard Business Press, 2009).

打造制胜之道：参见劳伦斯·萨斯金德和哈勒姆·莫维乌斯合著的《打造制胜之道：打造世界一流的谈判组织》（哈佛商业出版社，2009 年）。

UN diplomat Lakhdar Brahimi : The comment that follows was made during a seminar that was held when he received PON’s Great Negotiator Award in 2002. Video of the event is available from the Program’s Clearinghouse: www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2 .

联合国外交官拉赫达尔·布拉希米：以下评论是在他于 2002 年获得 PON 的“伟大谈判者奖”时举行的一次研讨会上发表的。该活动的视频可从该项目的信息中心获取：www.pon.harvard.edu/shop/great-negotiator-2002-lakhdar-brahimi-2。

Chapter 13: Fair Enough

第十三章：公平起见

Every time we sit down : For an extensive examination of ethical issues in negotiation, see the articles and essays collected in Carrie Menkel-Meadow and Michael Wheeler, eds., What’s Fair?: Ethics for Negotiators (Jossey-Bass, 2004). See also Robert Mnookin, Bargaining with the Devil: When to Negotiate, When to Fight (Simon & Schuster, 2011); G. Richard Schell, chap. 11, “Bargaining with the Devil Without Losing Your Soul: Ethics in Negotiation,” in Bargaining for Advantage: Negotiation Strategies for Reasonable People (Penguin Books, 2006); and Malhotra and Bazerman, Negotiation Genius (Bantam Books, 2007), in particular, chapter 9, “Confronting Lies and Deceptions,” and chapter 10, “Recognizing and Resolving Ethical Dilemmas.”

每次我们坐下来谈判时：如需深入探讨谈判中的伦理问题，请参阅 Carrie Menkel-Meadow 和 Michael Wheeler 主编的《何为公平？：谈判者的伦理》（Jossey-Bass 出版社，2004 年）一书中的文章和论文集。另请参阅 Robert Mnookin 的《与魔鬼讨价还价：何时谈判，何时战斗》（Simon & Schuster 出版社，2011 年）；G. Richard Schell 的《谈判优势：理性人士的谈判策略》（Penguin Books 出版社，2006 年）第 11 章“与魔鬼讨价还价而不失去灵魂：谈判中的伦理”；以及 Malhotra 和 Bazerman 的《谈判天才》（Bantam Books 出版社，2007 年），特别是第 9 章“直面谎言和欺骗”和第 10 章“识别和解决伦理困境”。

Recent scientific findings : See Jonathan Haidt, “The New Synthesis in Moral Psychology,” Science 316, no. 5827 (May 18, 2007): pp. 998–1002. See also Jonathan Haidt, The Righteous Mind: Why Good People Are Divided by Politics and Religion (Pantheon Books, 2012).

近期科学发现：参见 Jonathan Haidt，“道德心理学的新综合”，《科学》316，第 5827 期（2007 年 5 月 18 日）：第 998-1002 页。另见 Jonathan Haidt，《正义之心：为什么好人会因政治和宗教而分裂》（Pantheon Books，2012 年）。

Good intentions aren’t enough : See Joris Lammers, Diederik Stapel, and Adam Galinsky, “Power Increases Hypocrisy: Moralizing in Reasoning, Immorality in Behavior,” Psychological Science 21, no. 5 (May 2010): pp. 737–44.

良好的意愿是不够的：参见 Joris Lammers、Diederik Stapel 和 Adam Galinsky 的文章“权力加剧虚伪：推理中的道德化，行为中的不道德”，《心理科学》21，第 5 期（2010 年 5 月）：第 737-44 页。

Remember the energy traders : To hear the X-rated conversation, go to www.youtube.com/watch?v=DOLNWF5QMxY .

还记得那些能源交易员吗？要听听那段限制级对话，请访问 www.youtube.com/watch?v=DOLNWF5QMxY。

Our moral sensitivity may slacken : Norman is a pseudonym. I’m grateful to him for sharing this story.

我们的道德敏感度可能会降低：诺曼是化名。我很感谢他分享这个故事。

In fact, a newsmagazine : See Douglas Stanglin et al., “Oprah: A Heavenly Body?” U.S. News & World Report , March 31, 1997, p. 18.

事实上，一份新闻杂志：参见 Douglas Stanglin 等人，“奥普拉：天体？”《美国新闻与世界报道》，1997 年 3 月 31 日，第 18 页。

The authors maintained : See Fisher, Ury, and Patton, p. 154.

作者们坚持认为：参见 Fisher、Ury 和 Patton，第 154 页。

A reviewer friendly : See Carrie Menkel-Meadow, “Legal Negotiation: A Study of Strategies in Search of a Theory,” American Bar Foundation Research Journal 8, no. 4 (Autumn 1983), pp. 905–37, at 919.

方便审稿人参考：请参阅 Carrie Menkel-Meadow，“法律谈判：寻求理论的策略研究”，《美国律师基金会研究杂志》8，第 4 期（1983 年秋季），第 905-37 页，第 919 页。

In sharp contrast : See Cohen, You Can Negotiate Anything . Cohen’s reference to Jesus Christ and Socrates is at p. 20. Cohen describes the episode that follows on p. 227.

与此形成鲜明对比的是：参见科恩的《任何事都能谈判》。科恩在第20页提到了耶稣基督和苏格拉底。科恩在第227页描述了接下来的事件。

his actual advice was : A. Press, C. Glass, and D. Foote, “Winning by Negotiation,” Newsweek , October 26, 1981, p. 86.

他实际的建议是：A. Press、C. Glass 和 D. Foote，“通过谈判取胜”，《新闻周刊》，1981 年 10 月 26 日，第 86 页。

My friend Jim Golden : For more on Jim’s openhearted and practical approach to negotiation, see Jim Golden, “The Negotiation Counsel Model,” Negotiation Journal 24, no. 3 (July 2008): pp. 371–78.

我的朋友吉姆·戈尔登：有关吉姆坦诚务实的谈判方法的更多信息，请参阅吉姆·戈尔登的文章“谈判顾问模式”，《谈判杂志》24，第3期（2008年7月）：第371-378页。

My colleague Andy Wasynczuk : See Andrew Wasynczuk, Katherine Dowd, and Sara del Nido, Golden Rule (product number 909017), October 27, 2010, Harvard Business Publishing.

我的同事 Andy Wasynczuk：参见 Andrew Wasynczuk、Katherine Dowd 和 Sara del Nido 合著的《黄金法则》（产品编号 909017），2010 年 10 月 27 日，哈佛商业出版社出版。

Wheeler, Michael.

惠勒，迈克尔。

The art of negotiation : how to improvise agreement in a chaotic world / by Michael Wheeler, Harvard Business School.

谈判的艺术：如何在混乱的世界中即兴达成协议 / 作者：迈克尔·惠勒，哈佛商学院。
